p: The weights of the different factors that influence the risk of RVFV transmission by vectors were determined by means of the paired comparison method developed by Saaty [ 23]. The relative importance of each of the n factors relative to every other factor was evaluated using a 9-point reciprocal scale, in which 1 represents equal importance and 9 extreme importance, while 1/9 would represent of extremely low importance [ 23]. That results in a n x n matrix of pairwise comparisons, and the dominant eigenvector of that matrix corresponds to the vector of relative weights for the n factors.
